metatags.twitter:title: Boston, other cities work to curb renewable energy costs
metatags.twitter:description: BOSTON - Houston, Chicago, Los Angeles and other major cities have joined Boston to explore a potentially massive renewable energy procurement, Boston Mayor Marty Walsh announced Thursday at a climate summit.At the International Mayors Climate Summit in Boston, Walsh urged other mayors to join the initiative. metatags.twitter:title: LETTER: Gas pipeline leaks are killing Brookline's trees
metatags.twitter:description: To the editor:What is a ghost tree?Have you noticed black and white signs and stencils surrounding street trees in Brookline? Nearly 50 volunteers organized by Mothers Out Front Brookline placed these markers on the morning of Saturday, May 12. The purpose of the markers is to raise awareness of the beautiful trees that no longer shade the streets of Brookline.These “Ghost Trees” have been killed by leaking natural gas. Gas suffocates trees by depriving the roots of the oxygen

metatags.twitter:title: Senate tees up bill to boost clean-energy development
metatags.twitter:description: BOSTON - Utilities would need to ramp up renewable-energy purchases, the state could dramatically expand its support of offshore wind, and commercial solar endeavors would be freed from existing restrictions, under legislation the Senate plans to take up next week.The bill is sure to please the renewable-energy industry and will likely raise concerns among other business interests in the electricity sector.The 32-section legislation would also require the state to create "market-based
